case_title: Dr. BASHIR AHMED KHAWAJA, LIVESTOCK OFFICER, FARM L.D.R.C. AMBORE, MUZAFFARABAD vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU & KASHMIR through its Chief Secretary and 5 others
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondents: AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU & KASHMIR through its Chief Secretary

appellant_claims: Respondents No. 5 and 6 were wrongly included in the Department of Extension, Research and Development.
Respondents No. 5 and 6 belong to the Animal Health Department.
Impugned seniority list infringed appellant's rights.
respondent_objections: Appellant is NPS B-17, while Respondent No. 5 is NPS B-18.
Appellant's objections to provisional seniority list were considered but rejected.
respondent_justifications: Respondent No. 5 opted for inclusion in Extension, Research and Development.
Educational qualification (DVM) is valid for both departments.
additional_notes: Respondent No. 6 passed away in 2005; appeal abetted to his extent.
Appellant did not file replication to respondent objections.
Appellant failed to demonstrate how he was aggrieved by the seniority list.

findings: Respondent No. 5's inclusion in the seniority list was valid.
Appellant did not provide sufficient evidence to justify claims.
Appellant does not meet the criteria of an aggrieved person.
judgment_summary.decision: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs.
